February 18, 1969
Mr. Frank Pace, Jr.
Chairman of the Board
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
555 Madison Avenue
New York, New York 10022
Dear Mr. Pace:
On behalf of the National Educational Radio Board of
Directors, the NERN Program Advisory Committee and
the radio stations affiliated with NER, I am writing
to acknowledge the Corporation for Public Broad¬
casting grant totaling $65,000 for support of the
tape network.
As your letter suggests, it is a modest beginning
but a highly appropriate one. The network has served
educational stations well for many years. The CPB
funds will allow a marked improvement. Our efforts
will be directed toward the most appropriate utili¬
zation of the funds so that prime benefit will accrue
for the Individual stations and the listeners they
serve.
We are looking forward to the completion of the Public
Radio Study. NER trusts that the study will give us
guidance and direction for the future development of
radio.
There seems to be growing concern among radio station
managers regarding an interconnection for radio net¬
working among educational stations. The success 6f
the ETV network has clearly whetted the appetites of
the radio stations for a like service.
I am delighted to work with Don Quayle in the admin¬
istration of the NERN grant. Appropriate reports
will be submitted to CPB at the conclusion of the
project.
Sincerely,
RAM: lkl
cc: William G. Harley
Robert A. Mott
